intro: Nardosmia doerfleri, commonly known as the sweet vernal grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces a distinctive, sweet-smelling fragrance, which is most noticeable when the flowers are in full bloom. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Nardosmia doerfleri is often considered a valuable component of biodiversity-rich ecosystems.
